item.text: During David’s reign there was a famine for three consecutive years. So David inquired of the Lord. The Lord said, “It is because of Saul and his bloodstained family, because he murdered the Gibeonites.”

So the king summoned the Gibeonites and spoke with them. (Now the Gibeonites were not descendants of Israel; they were a remnant of the Amorites. The Israelites had made a promise to them, but Saul tried to kill them because of his zeal for the people of Israel and Judah.)
David said to the Gibeonites, “What can I do for you, and how can I make amends so that you will bless the Lord’s inheritance?”

The Gibeonites said to him, “We have no claim to silver or gold from Saul or from his family, nor would we be justified in putting to death anyone in Israel.” David asked, “What then are you asking me to do for you?”

They <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, “As for this <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="03615" class="">exterminated</st> us and <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01819" class="">schemed</st> against us so that we were <st data-num="08045" class="">destroyed</st> and <st data-num="03320" class="">left without status</st> throughout <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">borders</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>—
let seven of his male descendants be turned over to us, and we will execute them before the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, who was the Lord’s chosen one.” The king replied, “I will turn them over.”
The king had mercy on Mephibosheth son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, in light of the Lord’s oath that had been taken between David and Jonathan son of Saul.

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="0764" class="">Armoni</st> and <st data-num="04648" class="">Mephibosheth</st>, the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0345" class="">Aiah’s</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> <st data-num="07532" class="">Rizpah</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> she had <st data-num="03205" class="">born</st> to <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st>, and the <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> <st data-num="04764" class="">Merab</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> she had <st data-num="03205" class="">born</st> to <st data-num="05741" class="">Adriel</st> the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01271" class="">Barzillai</st> the <st data-num="04259" class="">Meholathite</st>.

He turned them over to the Gibeonites, and they executed them on a hill before the Lord. The seven of them died together; they were put to death during harvest time—during the first days of the beginning of the barley harvest.

Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it out for herself on a rock. From the beginning of the harvest until the rain fell on them, she did not allow the birds of the air to feed on them by day, nor the wild animals by night.

When <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> was <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> <st data-num="07532" class="">Rizpah</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="0345" class="">Aiah</st>, <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="06370" class="">concubine</st>, had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st>,

<st data-num="01732" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="06106" class="">bones</st> of <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="06106" class="">and</st> of his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="01167" class="">leaders</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03003" class="">Jabesh</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>. (They had <st data-num="01589" class="">secretly taken</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">them</st> from the <st data-num="07339" class="">plaza</st> at <st data-num="01052" class="">Beth Shan</st>. <st data-num="0834" class="">It</st> was <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> that <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="08518" class="">publicly exposed</st> their corpses<n id="6" /> <st data-num="03117" class="">after</st><n id="7" /> <st data-num="06430" class="">they</st><n id="8" /> had <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> at <st data-num="01533" class="">Gilboa</st>.)
David brought the bones of Saul and of Jonathan his son from there; they also gathered up the bones of those who had been executed.

They buried the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan in the land of Benjamin at Zela in the grave of his father Kish. After they had done everything that the king had commanded, God responded to their prayers for the land.
Another battle was fought between the Philistines and Israel. So David went down with his soldiers and fought the Philistines. David became exhausted.

Now <st data-num="03430" class="">Ishbi-Benob</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="03211" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="07497" class="">Rapha</st>,<n id="1" /> had a <st data-num="07013" class="">spear</st><n id="2" /> that <st data-num="04948" class="">weighed</st> <st data-num="07969 03967" class="">300</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="02296" class="">armed</st> with a <st data-num="02319" class="">new</st> weapon.<n id="4" /> He had <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> that he would <st data-num="05221" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.

But Abishai the son of Zeruiah came to David’s aid, striking the Philistine down and killing him. Then David’s men took an oath saying, “You will not go out to battle with us again! You must not extinguish the lamp of Israel!”
Later there was another battle with the Philistines, this time in Gob. On that occasion Sibbekai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was one of the descendants of Rapha.

Yet <st data-num="05750" class="">another</st> <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">occurred</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> in <st data-num="01359" class="">Gob</st>. On that occasion <st data-num="0445" class="">Elhanan</st> the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03265" class="">Jair</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01022" class="">Bethlehemite</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> the <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> of <st data-num="01555" class="">Goliath</st> the <st data-num="01663" class="">Gittite</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="06086" class="">shaft</st> of whose <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st> was like a <st data-num="0707" class="">weaver’s</st> <st data-num="04500" class="">beam</st>.

Yet <st data-num="05750" class="">another</st> <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">occurred</st> in <st data-num="01661" class="">Gath</st>. On that occasion there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> a <st data-num="04067" class="">large</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st><n id="1" /> who had <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="0676" class="">fingers</st> on each <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="0676" class="">toes</st> on each <st data-num="07272" class="">foot</st>, <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="04557" class="">in all</st>! <st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">too</st> was a <st data-num="03205" class="">descendant</st> of <st data-num="07497" class="">Rapha</st>.

When he <st data-num="02778" class="">taunted</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="08096" class="">Shimeah</st>, <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> him.
These four were the descendants of Rapha who lived in Gath; they were killed by David and his soldiers.
